string-array.item: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. - Socrates
In three words I can sum up everything I\'ve learned about life: it goes on. - Robert Frost
To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. - Confucius
The unexamined life is not worth living. - Socrates
It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it. - Aristotle
The only way to deal with life is to enjoy and embrace it. - Alan Watts
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. - Nelson Mandela
The unexamined life is not worth living. - Socrates
To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Life is what happens when you\'re busy making other plans. - John Lennon
You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength. - Marcus Aurelius
Change your thoughts and you change your world. - Norman Vincent Peale
The only real wisdom is recognizing how little we know. - Socrates
Our life is what our thoughts make it. - Marcus Aurelius
The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge. - Bertrand Russell
The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less. - Socrates
You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream. - C.S. Lewis
He who is not a good servant will not be a good master. - Plato
The greatest wealth is to live content with little. - Plato
Man is the measure of all things. - Protagoras
To find yourself, think for yourself. - Socrates
Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants. - Epictetus
There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path. - Buddha
The only source of knowledge is experience. - Albert Einstein
Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats. - Voltaire
The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best. - Epictetus
I think, therefore I am. - René Descartes
You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life. - Albert Camus
It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable. - Seneca
